8.13.17  11:56 pm   Hello Bill, I know this is probably very frequently asked but I am a new piano player and know a bit of songs, but I can only play right hand. I have tried for months to get down left hand but just can't, I've tried scales and even a couple of exercises.Is there any kind of trick to completing this goal? Thank you very much for your time.

8.13.17  10:29 pm   You know, I was thinking: part of the reason it takes a while to process and upload reality videos is because you add graphics and texts to the audio, right?

     Since you mentioned that it would be boring to just hear you speak/ramble on about your life. But, to be honest, I think many of your fans are endlessly fascinated by everything you do, no matter how seemingly inconsequential or boring; so if you ever wanted or needed to, I bet you could release straight audio and we would all be pretty all right with that. Have you ever considered this?
8.13.17  9:10 pm   Why do you make weird videos?

8.13.17  3:16 pm   Hey, I asked a question a little while ago about vocal harmonies. Another thing I'm curious about, that I forgot to mention in my other question, is doubling notes in different instruments.

     For simplicity sake, say you have a good old ii-V-I in C. If the bass player is playing the roots, D to G to C, then on piano I won't want to play the chords starting on those same roots. So I'd maybe play FACE, FABE, then EABD.

      Okay. So, then say I want to add maybe a 4 part vocal harmony over that, or a 4 part horn arrangement.

      Would I want that arrangement to have the same extensions that I'm doing on piano (Dm9, G9/13, Cmaj6/9)? Is it a good strategy to take the same notes the piano is playing, but just voice them in a different order/inversion? Do I want to double all those same notes? I know there's not set "rules" or anything. And you can write horn arrangements/vocal arrangements in any way that sounds good to you. But I'm new to this kind of thing, and ju st inter ested in any tips or "strategies" you may have.

8.13.17  2:39 pm   I love the vocal harmonies in your songs! Do you have any advice on writing vocal harmonies? I know you want to write the parts in the range the singer is most comfortable singing.. but in terms of the specific voicings, are there voicings that you think work well on piano, but not so much with voice (or vice versa)? I guess, in general, im curious if you approach voicing harmony differently for different instruments? Would you write a vocal harmony differently then a horn arrangement, etc? Or do the same techniques apply across the board?

8.13.17  5:10 am   Do people still give you a hard time about not posting videos

8.13.17  4:46 am   Hey Bill, you keep an audio journal. I am interested in keeping a journal, but I'm torn between audio and text. On one hand, audio is extremely easy to /create/. On the other hand, text is much easier to /manipulate/. For example, easily skipping back and forth, seeing context, and (most important!) search.  Right now, I use speech to text on my phone, but I have to edit it because it's fairly inaccurate. So, I want to ask, why did you choose audio?

     How do you deal with the inefficiencies of audio manipulation?
